titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Arthur Clarence Walworth Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by John Espy

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 09:20

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, research materials, and writings on Woodrow Wilson, Commodore Perry's expedition, and American diplomacy at the end of World War I. Correspondence with biographer Phyllis Levin is included in the papers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Arthur Clarence Walworth Papers (MS 532). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: With the exception of one box, the papers were deposited by Arthur C. Walworth, 1972-1993 and 1999; and were the gift of Ellen R. Ebersole, 1993. Accession 1995-M-091 was deposited by Ellen Ebersole in 1994. Gift of Arthur C. Walworth, 2004.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, research materials, and writings on Woodrow Wilson, Commodore Perry's expedition, and American diplomacy at the end of World War I. Correspondence with biographer Phyllis Levin is included in the papers.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by Ellen Rose Ebersole, the Donor, of this collection for materials authored or otherwise produced by Arthur C. Walworth. After the lifetime of the Donor, her copyright passes to Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Letter from Roger Louis re Walworth manuscript
Correspondence with staff of Yale-China Association [includes printed materials]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of a recording made on June 7, 1989, during which Arthur Walworth reads an account of his 1925 visit to the Republic of China to an unidentified audience at North Hill. Walworth recalls arriving in Ch'ang-sha, the capital of Hunan sheng (province), where he taught English at the Yale-in-China medical school. The account continues with descriptions of student protests and other revolutionary activities that rocked China as Nationalist and Communist forces clashed. The tape also includes Walworth's interactions with Christian missionaries in China; descriptions of Chinese leaders, such as Chiang Kai-shek and Mao Tse-tung; and Walworth's personal experiences and reflections on his trip.
